channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Philippines surpass 157,000 with 4,351 new infections
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Over 20.73 million cases of the coronavirus, including around 751,000 deaths, have been recorded globally by the World Health Organization in its latest situation report.

item.title: Comelec to resume voter registration on September 1 except in MECQ, ECQ areas
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Voter registration in areas under ECQ or MECQ would automatically resume once their classification is downgraded to general community quarantine, modified GCQ or lifted entirely.

item.title: Transport leaders asked to help enforce quarantine rules
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: This is in response to reports that some tricycle drivers, especially in the provinces, are not observing proper physical distancing and wearing face masks.

item.title: 'Earth not healing': Medical waste piles up as COVID-19 cases rise
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: As COVID-19 cases continue to pile up, putting pressure on hospitals, medical facilities are also seeing a surge in the volume of infectious health care waste they produce.

item.title: GCQ, MGCQ extended until August 31; decision on MECQ areas out Monday
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The new classification of areas currently under modified enhanced community quarantine will be announced by President Rodrigo Duterte next Monday.

item.title: Contact tracing tool 'SafePass' is now available for everyone
item.author: Rosette Adel
item.description: SafePass, a COVID incident mitigation and management solution, on Friday relaunched a free version of the system that makes it accessible to all Filipino establishments nationwide

item.title: 79th Malasakit Center opens in Laguna
item.description: Sen. Bong Go, chair of the committee on health and demography, attended the “virtual” launch of the country’s 79th Malasakit Center at the Laguna Medical Center in Santa Cruz. The Malasakit Center is the 40th in Luzon and sixth in Calabarzon.

item.title: Locsin backs P10 billion aid to tourism businesses, not TIEZA
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. has backed the proposal of Cagayan de Oro City Rep. Rufus Rodriguez to allocate P10 billion in the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act to the Department of Tourism itself and not to the Tourism Infrastructure and Enterprise Zone Authority.

item.title: PGH: Rapid tests not for COVID-19 screening
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Philippine General Hospital is opposed to the use of rapid antibody test in screening patients for COVID-19, saying it could not detect 80 percent of infected individuals.

item.title: DILG, DOH launch ‘BIDA ang may Disiplina’ vs COVID-19
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government and Department of Health have launched a joint discipline advocacy campaign aimed at instilling minimum health protocols in communities for a “new normal” amid the coronavirus disease pandemic.
